snippet: Since the Dannemora, N.Y., prison opened in 1845, dozens of inmates have escaped over, under or through the prison’s thick walls, their exploits detailed in newspaper reports of earlier eras.
abstract: Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, NY, is one of New York State's oldest and most remote prisons, where many prisoners have tried many means of escape, with varying degrees of success, over years.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

lead_paragraph: Since the Dannemora, N.Y., prison opened in 1845, dozens of inmates have escaped over, under or through the prison’s thick walls, their exploits detailed in newspaper reports of earlier eras.

headline.main: Tunnels, Disguises and Sewers: Clinton Prison’s Inmates Have Found Many Ways to Flee
headline.print_headline: Tunnels, Disguises and Sewers: A Prison’s Inmates Have Found Many Ways to Flee
